subject: Negotiation
title: Avoiding Cultural Stereotypes
description: A fast breakdown of Avoiding Cultural Stereotypes for builders.

hook.text: Not every Japanese person is indirect. Not every American is aggressive. Stereotypes are shortcuts that mislead.

buildup.text: Cultural frameworks describe tendencies, not rules. Every individual is shaped by personal experience too.

discovery.text: Using cultural knowledge as a starting point â€” not a conclusion â€” prevents offensive assumptions.

twist.text: The most culturally intelligent move: ask people about their preferences instead of assuming them.

climax.text: Treat cultural knowledge as a hypothesis to test, not a label to apply.

punchline.text: Study cultures. But negotiate with individuals.

quiz.question: How should you use cultural knowledge in negotiations?
options: Apply cultural stereotypes to every person from that culture
Use it as a starting point and then learn each individual's preferences
Ignore culture entirely and treat everyone the same
